instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging "X" battery detection
threads.message:
machine got liquid spilled. no power , big area spilled and fixed. power on then got the typical battery not being detected with "X"
want to mention first, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> was shorted and bad, replaced. (previously board can't power on when battery inserted) .

ok , so
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL>=3.3v stable
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL>   jumping around 0.2-3v 

so i thought <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> line must be the cause, replaced ISL 6259. no luck . then replaced the SMC , no luck . exact same thing. (machine can still power on)

I checked around the isl 6259 area, but didn't find broken trace. pin 10 of isl 6259 goes to the pad under smc as checked.

really out of direction at this moment, this board is giving me hard time and want to get out of hands ASAP, any suggestion will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging "X" battery detection
threads.message: Known good battery? PPBUS voltage without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging "X" battery detection
threads.message:
yes tried with a known good battery been using for repairs. ppbus around 9v.

the <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> jumping around 0.2-3v with or without battery. makes no difference

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging "X" battery detection
threads.message:
Around 9V....please be more specific.
<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/81 checked? There is nothing more to this unless you got another dead SMC.
